mlutils.plotting.forecasting module¶

mlutils.plotting.forecasting.animate_forecast(forecasts, true_values, date_offset, y_lim_mod=0.2, interval=300, ylims=None)¶

Produces an animation of given forecasts atop the original values.

Parameters

  • forecasts –

  • true_values –

  • date_offset – date offset left and right to the currently shown forecast

  • y_lim_mod – percentage of the currently shown y amplitude to be added to each side of ylim

  • interval – interval between frames in miliseconds

  • ylims – Sets ylim during the whole animation. If set, ignores y_lim_mod and ylim is not auto adjusted during the animation.

Returns

the animation object that needs to be stored for the duration of the animation (or for however long you need it to run)

mlutils.plotting.timeseries module¶

mlutils.plotting.timeseries.plot_seasonal_decompose(observed, seasonal, trend, resid, figsize=(20, 12), period_name=None)¶

Plotting of a seasonal decomposition on 4 axes, one for each component. Components are plotted in the order: observed, seasonal, trend and residuals. plt.show() still needs to be called after this function.

Parameters

  • decompose – result of a statsmodels decomposition (STL, seasonal_decompose, etc.)

  • figsize – figsize of the whole plot

  • period_name – Used to adjust titles, examples are “Weekly”, “Daily”, etc.

Returns

tuple of 4 axes
